description: Includes English Creole languages such as Guyanese Creole, Jamaican English Creole Patois, Krio, Nigerian Pidgin, Pidgin English
Includes Cajun, Canadian French, French Creole (other than Haitian Creole)
Includes Neapolitan, Sicilian
Includes Brazilian Portuguese, Portuguese Creole, Cape Verdean, Crioulo, Papiamento

language_category: Yiddish, Pennsylvania Dutch, or other West Germanic Languages
description: Includes Afrikaans, Dutch, Flemish, Frisian, Luxembourgish, Scots, Low German
Includes Bosnian, Croatian, Montenegrin, Serbian, Serbo-Croatian
Includes Belarusian, Bulgarian, Czech, Macedonian, Slovak
Includes Farsi, Dari, Hazaragi, Tadzhik, Tajik
Includes Panjabi, Mirpuri
Includes Bangla, Chittagonian, Sylheti

language_category: Nepali, Marathi, or other Indic languages
description: Includes Bhojpuri, Fiji Hindi, Indo-Fiji, Haryanvi, Hindko, Kachchhi, Kutchi, Pothwari, Saraiki, Sindhi, Sinhala, Sinhalese
Includes Albanian, Aragonese, Balochi, Catalan, Danish, Faroese, Icelandic, Latvian, Lithuanian, Moldovan, Moldavian, Norwegian, Romani, Romanian, Swedish, Valencian
Includes Kurdish (including Badini, Kurmanji, Sorani, Northern Kurdish), Pashto, Pushto

language_category: Malayalam, Kannada, or other Dravidian languages
description: Includes Tulu, Gondi, Brahui
Includes all Chinese dialects (Mandarin, Cantonese, Hakka, Teochew Min, Chui Chow, Nanjing, Wu, etc)
Includes Cambodian

language_category: Thai, Lao, or other Tai-Kadai languages
description: Includes Central Thai, Shan
Includes Burmese, Chaozhou, Chin, Dzongkha, Eastern Pwo, Falam, Hakha, Hmong, Karen, Karenni, Kayah, Mien, Mizo, Mongolian, Pwo Northern Rohingya, Philippine (Other), Tedim, Tibetan, Zanniat
Includes Filipino

language_category: Ilocano, Samoan, Hawaiian, or other Austronesian languages
description: Includes Bikol, Cebuano, Chuukese, Fijian, Hilgaynon, Ilonggo, Indonesian, Jakartanese, Javanese, Malagasy, Malay, Marshallese, Nauru, Phrae Pwo, Tahitian, Tongan, Trukese, Visayan, Yapese
Includes all Arabic regional dialects (Egyptian, Algerian, Sudanese, etc)

language_category: Amharic, Somali, or other Afro-Asiatic languages
description: Includes Afar, Borana, Chaldean, Eritrean, Ethiopian, Garre, Hausa, Maay Maay, Oromo, Oromifa, Tigrinya, Tigrigna

language_category: Yoruba, Twi, Igbo, or other languages of Western Africa
description: Includes Akan, Ashanti, Asante, Fante, Bambara, Bamana, Djerma, Dyula, Jula, Dioula, Edo, Bini, Ewe, Fon, Fula, Fulah, Fulani, Ga, Gio, Ibo, Kirike, Lingala, Malinke, Mande, Mandingo, Mandinka, Mina, Pular, Pulaar, Soninke, Wolof, Zarma

language_category: Swahili or other languages of Central, Eastern, and Southern Africa
description: Includes Anuak, Bravanese, Chimwiini, Chichewa, Chizigula, Kizigua, Dinka, Ganda, Luganda, Kibajuni, Kikuyu, Kinyabwisha, Kinyamulenge, Kinyarwanda, Kirundi, Kisii, Kiswahili, Kongo, Kunama, Luba-Kasai, Luo, Nuer, Rundi, Sangho, Sango, Sotho, Tshiluba, Zulu

language_category: Other Native languages of North America
description: Includes Cree, Mixtec, Mixteco, Ojibwa as well as any other indigenous language from Mexico, United States, or Canada

Includes Abkhaz, Akatek, Akateko, Aymara, Azerbaijani, Basque, Berber, Esperanto, Estonian, Finnish, Gaelic, Georgian, Guarani, Hungarian, Chuj, Cakchiquel, Kaqchikel, Kajobal, Kazakh, Q'anjob'al, Kekchi, Q'eqchi, K'iche', Northern Sami, Quiche, Kyrgyz, Mam, Quechua, Turkish, Turkmen, Uyghur, Uzbek
Includes American Sign Language as well as any other recognized form of sign language
Includes Patient Declined, Non-Verbal/Non-Signing Patients
